availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Anderon Hunt (Mercer County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, physician. North Carolina native. Married to Anna Adair Bridges Hunt on March 19, 1838 in Mercer County, Kentucky. Father of Thomas Hunt, John B. Hunt, Mary F. Hunt, Elizabeth D. Hunt, Benjamin B. Hunt, Anna B. Hunt, Edna M. Hunt, and Hannah Hunt. Physician in Mercer County in 1850. Physician in Mercer County in 1860. Owned two enslaved individuals in Mercer County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 1, p. 275B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 1, p. 821.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 687.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 582A.
Find A Grave, "Dr. James Anderson Hunt (Dec. 22, 1808-Jan. 19, 1892)," Memorial #91975907, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/91975907(accessed April 1, 2020).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191856, p. 43.
